name: Chirp
overview:
Chirp is a new way to share your stuff – using sound. Chirp sings information from one device to another.

The app uses special electronic birdsong to ‘chirp’ information over the air to your friends. Users can share photos, webpages, contacts.

Every chirp is a little song that links to anything you want to share. It can quickly send data to multiple devices at once without them needing to be either paired or have a wireless connection.

Chirp solves the problem of having to pair devices to move data, and allows users and broadcasters alike to transmit information to anyone who is in earshot - so a large number of devices can share the same information at the same time.

The platform was developed by Animal Systems, a spin-off business from University College London (UCL) Department of Computer Science.
